data.title: Half fake, half real, but a good mix of things to see and do

data.title: Old West All American Cute Town
data.text:
Love to go to the Farmers Markets or stroll around at the evenings.  It is lovely!  God bless America!!!
 
The Antique Stores, the Clubs, the City Hall with the Library which I love and visit every week, the water tower all the eateries very live  we are a great city that would make any visitor happy.  Love the hanging city sign the Welcome all to the Sierras... that and more is beautiful All American Old Town Clovis.

The museum would be a must visit and take a picture with the Native American mannequin  that is outside one of the Antique Store.

data.title: Quaint
data.text: In Old Town Clovis you will find delightful antique shops, fun festivals and a fabulous farmers market on Friday evenings (seasonal) and Saturday mornings.  Stop by Kuppa Joy for a cup of coffee or into Rev's for a fantastic lunch or dinner! So many locally owned shops to peek into as well.

data.title: Downtown Clovis a real gem.
data.text: I have lived in Clovis for 30 years and am truly impressed the way the City has developed Old Town. All of the business owners are very proud of the area and it shows. It is enjoyable to walk Pollasky and visit the various shops and restaurants.

data.title: Farmer's Market
data.text: Summer Friday evenings are special in Old Town Clovis- it's Farmer's Market time.  Actually, it's more than Farmer's Market, as good as that is!  There's a great selection of home grown fruits and vegetables where you can ask questions and talk with the growers while purchasing their produce and then meander through town, visiting the antique shops or have dinner at Luba's Pizzeria, or hanging out and listening to the live music at the market.  Whatever you chose to do, summer Friday evenings are a community affair in Old Town Clovis.

data.title: Old Town Times ARE a Changin - Good for Some - Not So Good for - Others
data.text: Old Town Clovis stands as the bastion of all things " Clovis.." *What the heck does that mean might you ask? Well, Clovis in the Fresno County area stands and is the representation of traditional culture and values, held by those folks living in a predominately - "Cowboy town; committed to maintaining traditional values and beliefs." In plain English: Clovis as compared to Fresno is a bit more conservative and laid back, all at the same time. The stores feature and old town traditional aesthetic and have their own country town charm all their own. In-fact, Clovis today, looks more like an old cowboy town than it did when I was a kid who actually "grew-up there."  The change is welcome and the folks for the most part are friendly and cordial. But, law enforcement has little tolerance for social deviants who would act foolishly. It's just not acceptable behavior in this neck of the woods.   The restaurants and shops are open and close at reasonable hours. The streets are well paved, clean, and easy to navigate. I believe that the town has become a bit more socially acceptable to individuals and families from diverse backgrounds, so yes, things seem to be going well for Clovis in 2016. A nice place to visit when you want a bit of the old town feel of semi-rural country life in Fresno County, circa 1945. *Recommended

data.title: Darling town!
data.text: Many fantastic shops, small town feel, clean, and great people. Awesome antique shops & restaurants. People walk along the sidewalks, are very friendly and just an overall great atmosphere!

data.title: Not a destination, but worth a visit
data.text: You wouldn't go out of your way to visit this area, but if it is convenient it is worth a stop. Several interesting shops and restaurants.

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: Get away from the heat (yes, Clovis does get hot in the summer) and stroll along the shaded streets of Old Town Clovis where you will find something for everyone.  The main attraction is the numerous antique shops where you can browse for hours but for those looking for something else, there is also a museum, an ice cream shop, clothing stores, sports memorabilia, a tea room, cafes and bars.

data.title: We love our Old Town
data.text: What is not to love about Old Town Clovis? While staying true to its roots, Clovis gives its residents things like Friday Farmer's Markets and a newer venue for outdoor events. You can walk from antique shop to antique shop during the day and restaurant to restaurant or bar to bar at night. Clovis does roll up its streets a little early, but it is Old Town, after all.

data.title: Lovely area to explore
data.text: While in town we went shopping in the Old Town area & loved it.  Several antique stores to browse.  We had a wonderful day walking around. There was even a lovely used bookstore called Book Nook that was pretty cool

data.title: P Scialabba
data.text: Strolling Old Town Clovis is a relaxing way an afternoon, several antiques shops, an ice cream parlor serving Fresno State ice cream, coffee spots, Sandys Country Junction is good and open for breakfast and lunch.

data.title: Saturday Night Live
data.text: Old Town Clovis always has something great going on. The Lounge is known for spotlighting some terrific homegrown talent.  The relaxed atmosphere is perfect for a first date or an anniversary.  If you are in a dancing mood, pop over to any of the nught spots in Clovis Ave and you're sure to have a great time.
